title: Feature Request: Hide Connection Tabs
author: leaskovski
body_snippet:
It would be nice to have the ability to hide the connection tabs.  Some people (such as myself) coming from Remote Desktop Connection Manager, are use to selecting a connection via the connection tree.  In conjunction with using the option "Single Click on opened connection in Connection Tree switches to opened Connection Tab", it would mean that the connection tabs almost become defunct.

This is in relation to the feature request #1096.

comments.snippet:
I've been thinking about this some more.  Maybe we don't need to hide the connection tabs as these can be useful.  Maybe what is needed is to select the connection in the connection tree when the tab is changed meaning that the highlighted connection tree item will always match the selected tab?

This might be a better solution (and easier to implement?)

comments.snippet: I would also like to hide tab strip! I only ever connect to one remote desktop, and I have enabled the option "Reconnect to previously opened sessions on startup", so I do not need anything shown besides the regular window title bar so I can move the window maximized/half-screen/etc as needed. I see the latest nightly build supports hiding the menu bar too, so the only remaining wasted screen space is the tab bar (and I guess some unnecessarily thick window borders, too),
